result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee F Hodge

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lee F Hodge appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Lee F Hodge.  Prosecuting attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Discussion held as to posture of the case. Court orders matter set for final pre-trial and jury trial. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Court also sets a deadline on 10/14/2022 for any suppression motions. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4. 
Defendant Lee F Hodge in Court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Attorney John J. Rejowski on behalf of Attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. For reasons stated on the record during the plea colloquy, Court was not able to proceed with the plea hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 4. Court returned plea paperwork to Defense.
Status hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am in Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Branch 4 in jury trial. Case spun to Judge Feiss Branch 46. Parties notified.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Branch 04 is down. Case rescheduled in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Corporal Sharif Said - West Allis P.D.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3/4/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co defendants: Willie A., John M. and Maxwell Lofts 214 E Florida, Milwaukee WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Lee F Hodge in court with attorney Katherine Graber.   Student Intern Josh Milder under the supervision of Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lee F Hodge not in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/1/22 @ 2:30p
